content:
The No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection shall not be applicable for any late notification or any failure in notification of an accident and/or occurrence by the Policyholder or Authorised Driver in accordance to Sub-Section 1 of Claims Conditions.

Please note that Your No Claim Discount (NCD) that is maintained under Our No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection cover may not be transferable to another insurer.

#### M13-All Workshop Plan
It is hereby understood and agreed that the Policy indemnifies You for the accident repairs costs carried out at Our chosen Approved Workshop or at any workshops of Your choice.

#### M14-Authorised Workshop Plan
It is hereby understood and agreed that the Policy indemnifies You for the accident repairs costs carried out at Our chosen Approved Workshop. We shall not be liable to indemnify You for the costs of any accident repairs to the Insured Vehicle other than Our chosen Approved Workshop.
questions: How does the requirement for timely notification of an accident or occurrence affect the applicability of the No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection, and what are the consequences of late or failed notifications under Sub-Section 1 of Claims Conditions?
In what ways does the No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection cover maintain the NCD, and what limitations exist regarding the transferability of this discount to another insurer?

Under the M13-All Workshop Plan, how does the policy accommodate repairs carried out at either the insurer's Approved Workshop or a workshop of the policyholder's choice, and what implications does this have for indemnity?
What restrictions does the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan impose on the choice of workshop for accident repairs, and how does this affect the insurer's liability for repair costs?

How do the notification requirements for claiming No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection interact with the choice of workshop plans (M13-All Workshop vs. M14-Authorised Workshop) in terms of claim eligibility and indemnity?

If a policyholder fails to notify an accident promptly but carries out repairs at an Approved Workshop under the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan, how does this impact the applicability of NCD Protection and repair cost indemnity?

What documentation or proof is required to demonstrate compliance with the notification conditions under Sub-Section 1 of Claims Conditions to maintain eligibility for No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection?
How does the policy define an 'Authorised Driver' in relation to the notification requirements for NCD Protection, and what are the implications if an unauthorised driver is involved in the accident?
In scenarios where repairs are conducted at a non-approved workshop under the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan, how does the policy address indemnity and what exclusions apply?
Can the No Claim Discount (NCD) maintained under the NCD Protection be applied if the policyholder switches insurers, and what policy provisions clarify this?
How do the indemnity provisions differ between the M13-All Workshop Plan and the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan regarding the policyholder's freedom to choose repair workshops?
What are the potential consequences on claim settlement if the policyholder chooses a workshop outside the insurer's Approved Workshop network under the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan?
How does the policy handle claims for accident repairs if the policyholder notifies the accident late but repairs are done at a workshop of their choice under the M13-All Workshop Plan?
What are the conditions under which the insurer may refuse indemnity for accident repairs despite repairs being carried out at an Approved Workshop?
How does the policy ensure that the No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection is only applicable when notification conditions are met, and what mechanisms are in place to verify timely notification?
In the event of an accident involving an Authorised Driver, how does the policy's notification requirement affect the maintenance of the No Claim Discount (NCD) under the Protection cover?
What is the relationship between the Claims Conditions' notification requirements and the indemnity coverage for accident repairs under the different workshop plans?
How might the policyholder's choice between the M13-All Workshop Plan and the M14-Authorised Workshop Plan influence their obligations and rights regarding accident notification and repair indemnity?
Are there any exceptions or special considerations within the policy for notification timing or workshop choice that affect the No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection or repair cost indemnity?
How does the policy address situations where repairs are partially done at an Approved Workshop and partially at a non-approved workshop in relation to indemnity and NCD Protection?
